eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule

Class MLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.MGeometricObject
      • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.MLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MGeometricObject>

    public class MLabel
extends MGeometricObject
    Minuscule label with various attributes, such as position, text, color, filling and parent (a MObject to which this label is bound). MLabel uses the Builder pattern to add new values to attributes, if not invoked, default values are used.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MLabel(java.lang.String text)
      Creates a new label with the given text and default properties.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public void copy(MLabel label)
        A copy constructor for MLabel. This is useful in various Geometric Objects in the method that sets the object's label to the given label. This constructor can be used to easily replace the old label with this new one.
        Parameters:
        label - The label which contents should be copied into this label

        Returns:
        The text of the label. Default value is empty string.

        the size of the label's font

      • isPositionSetByParent

        public boolean isPositionSetByParent()
        Returns:
        true if the label is movable (i.e. its position is determined by its parent), false otherwise (its position is entirely dependent only on parent's position and the label's position)

      • getAngleToParent

        public double getAngleToParent()
        Returns:
        An angle in degrees from the x-axis in positive direction at which the label is located relative to the parent

        Specified by:

        angleDeg - The angle relative to the x-axis in positive direction at which the label should be placed according to the object's properties

      • label

        public MLabel label(MLabel label)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Adds a custom label to the object, sets the object as its parent. That means that the label coordinates will be now relative to the parent's Label Base Coordinate. If the object already has any label, it will be replaced by this label. If you want the object to determine the label position for you automatically, use either label(String s) method or label(String s, int pos) method.
        Specified by:
        label in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        label - The label to be added to the object
        Returns:
        The object with the label set

      • layer

        public MLabel layer(int layer)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Sets the object's layer to the given value. The layer determines when the object is drawn - the higher layer, the later the object will be drawn.
        Specified by:
        layer in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:

      • parent

        public MLabel parent(MGeometricObject parent)
        Sets the parent for this label. If the parent is set, whenever it moves by vector (dx,dy) also the label is moved by vector (dx,dy).
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent of this label, i.e. an MGeometricObject that "owns" the label
        Returns:
        The label with a parent set

      • draw

        public MLabel draw(Canvas c)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Adds the object into the internal list of objects in the canvas and calls the repaint() method of the Canvas. Any modifications to the geometric object done after calling this method will be ignored (e.g. MPoint.draw(canvas).x(20).y(20);) will draw the point at the default (0, 0) coordinates).
        Specified by:
        draw in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        c - The canvas on which the object should be drawn
        Returns:
        The object that has been drawn

      • delete

        public void delete(Canvas c)
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Deletes the given object from the canvas. Also all objects which this object is parent to will be deleted.
        Overrides:
        delete in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        c - The canvas from which the object should be deleted

      • positionSetByParent

        public MLabel positionSetByParent(boolean value,
                                  double angleDeg)
        By default the label determines its position on its own. That means its position is determined by the position of the parent (if any) and the label's coordinates. If the label is set to be determined by the parent (i.e. positionSetByParent(true)), its position is determined by the method getLabelPosition() of the parent. Any coordinates of the label are ignored in this case. Only if the parent is null and hence its getLabelPosition() method can't be called, then the label's coordinates are used.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be set
        angleDeg - The position to the parent. See getPositionToBaseCoord() above for details.
        Returns:
        The label with the movability set

      • getLabelBaseCoordinate

        public MCoordinate getLabelBaseCoordinate()
        Returns the midpoint of the bounding rectangle
        Specified by:
        getLabelBaseCoordinate in class MGeometricObject
        Returns:
        The coordinate of the label base point

      • getLabelCoordinates

        public MCoordinate getLabelCoordinates(double angleDeg)
        Aligns the label's label to the bounding rectangle of the label.
        Specified by:
        getLabelCoordinates in class MGeometricObject
        Parameters:
        angleDeg - The angle at which the label should be put
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the label according to the given angle and the properties of the object

      • getBoundingRectangle

        public MBoundingBox getBoundingRectangle()
        Description copied from class: MGeometricObject
        Calculates the bounding rectangle of the given geometric object and returns it. The coordinates are absolute (i.e. relative to the origin, not to the parent object).
        Specified by:
        getBoundingRectangle in class MGeometricObject
        Returns:
        The bounding rectangle of the geometric object.
